edu.vt.middleware.password
Class PasswordCharacterRule

java.lang.Object
  edu.vt.middleware.password.AbstractPasswordRule
      edu.vt.middleware.password.PasswordCharacterRule
All Implemented Interfaces:
PasswordRule
public final class PasswordCharacterRule
extends AbstractPasswordRule

PasswordCharacterRule contains methods for determining if a password contains the desired mix of character types. In order to meet the criteria of this rule, passwords must have any number of the following five characteristics: (The default is to enforce none of the characteristics, so you must explicitly call the set methods you want to enforce.) 1) contain n or more digits 2) contain n or more alphabetical characters 3) contain n or more non-alphanumeric characters 4) contain n or more uppercase characters 5) contain n or more lowercase characters Where n can be set, but the default is 0.

Version:
$Revision: 959 $ $Date: 2009-10-28 16:36:58 -0400 (Wed, 28 Oct 2009) $
Author:
Middleware Services

Method Detail

setNumberOfCharacteristics

public void setNumberOfCharacteristics(int n)
This sets the number of characteristics which must be satisfied in order for a password to meet the requirements of this rule. The default is zero. i.e. you may wish to enforce any three of the five characteristics.

Parameters:
n - int number of characteristics to enforce where n >= 0

getNumberOfCharacteristics

public int getNumberOfCharacteristics()
This returns the number of characteristics which currently must be satisfied in order for a password to meet the requirements of this rule.

Returns:
int number of characteristics to enforce

setNumberOfDigits

public void setNumberOfDigits(int n)
This sets the number of digits to require in a password. The default is zero.

Parameters:
